attributes.action: Resign and call a General Election for presiding over a policy that destroyed final salary pension schemes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gordon Brown was advised in 1997, that withdrawing tax credit for dividends in pension schemes, would be highly damaging to personal pensions, especially final salary schemes. despite being advised this, the tax credits were withdrawn, severely damaging the retirment prospects of millions of citizens. Such financial incompetence is inexcusable, and becuase of collective cabinet responsibility, the Prime Minister should tender the resignation of this Government forthwith the Her Majesty the Queen, head of state

rejection.details: This is simiilar to the following open petition: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/resignTony/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
